question:
During a recent plane journey, you sat next to a businessman who owns a chain of restaurants. You talked to him and he suggested that you should contact him about a possible job in one of his restaurants.


Write a letter to this businessman. In your letter


- remind him when and where you met
- tell him what kind of job you are interested in
-say why you think you would be suitable for the job
text: This letter is in regards to express my interest,  to serve at your restaurant located at 'Parkinson Square'.

Although it has been long since we met on Vistara airline while travelling from New York to London last month. Nonetheless, I remembered your invitation to check open job positions at one of your hotels. Actually, due to some priorities at ,home I wasn't able to meet you soon after our travel.

My keen interest in working as a management professional. In fact, my overall experience is in management. Indeed, working in the hotel industry for the last 15 years has helped to hone my skills. Moreover, I saw a vacancy on your website and wanted to share that my expertise matches one of  the requirements mentioned in it.

Planning meetings, collecting feedbacks, quickness at decision making, resource optimization and a customer-centric approach in serving are namely few skills that make me suitable for this opportunity. Collaboration with other team members and good interpersonal skills is a plus point in my profile.
Request you to kindly let me know if any further details are needed from me.  Looking forward to hearing soon.
